result.execSummary:
All charges against Shannon F. Dio in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shannon F. Dio is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shannon F. Dio

records.addlTxt:
8:37 AM Defendant Shannon F. Dio appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Shannon F. Dio.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Both files heard: 22CF68, 22CF157

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant states his reason for wanting to appear by zoom. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.
If at any time the defendant needs to speak privately with his/her attorney, the court will make accommodations for that.
Defendant indicates he/she understands the right to be present in the courtroom and has discussed with his/her attorney.
BY THE COURT: Court finds the defendant is his right to be present in person knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily. 

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  22CF68 Count 2 would be amended to include as a repeater statute.  States the conviction that qualifies him for that.  
Court questions Atty Pfeil regarding the repeater statute. 
Atty Kryshak stipulates to the repeater statute being added. 
Attorney for defendant concurs with the agreement stated.

Court questions the date the defendant signed the plea questionnaire.  
Atty Kryshak responds. 
Court questions the reason for the outright dismissal of 22CF157.
Atty Pfeil responds and also states reason for dismissal of 22CF68 Count 1. 
Court questions Atty Pfeil regarding the 2 years probation length. 
Both parties agree that 2 years is appropriate. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present but had submitted a written statement.
Court questions defendant. 
Defendant agrees with the statements made by counsel. 
BY THE COURT:  Motion to dismiss 22CF157 outright is granted for the reasons stated on the record.  Court relies on the statements made in 22CF157 for the repeater statutes. 
Court questions if the state will be filing an amended information to complete the record. 
Atty Pfeil indicates he will file that. 
Atty Kryshak makes statements regarding the maximum penalty. 
Atty Pfeil agrees with the correction stated being 2 years rather than 4 years. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 22CF68 Count 2 - GUILTY

Court questions Atty Kryshak with regards to the ple questionnaire indicating a no contest plea. 
Atty Kryshak responds.  They are not contesting so the guilty plea can remain.
Court accepts the guilty plea. 

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of 22CF68 Count 1. 

Court questions the defendant regarding prior conviction. 
Defendant agrees he was convicted but unsure of the date. 
Court accepts the stipulation and also finds this charge will be as a repeater. 
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
22CF68 Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Pfeil makes sentencing arguments to the court.  
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Defendant does not make statements. 

BY THE COURT: 
22CF68 Count 2 - 
Sentence withheld. 
114 days jail credit. 
Placed on Probation for a period of 1 year, consecutive to the sentence he is currently serving. 
Conditions:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations at the discretion of the probation agent if the agent deems it to be necessary.
Prohibited from having, possessing or using any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only as the prescription requires. 
Provide a DNA sample or proof that one has previously been provided. 
Pay costs and surcharges.
Matter set for a P/S on 08/22/2022 at 8:30 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
3:19 PM Defendant Shannon F. Dio not in court.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Shannon F. Dio. 
Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Pfeil states the parties just learned that the defendant was moved to Dodge Correctional.  Requests to adjourn. 
Atty Kryshak concurs. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court finds good cause to continue to another date.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Letter to Branch 2 Judge from ADA Pfeil in re:  P.F.C. has consented in writing to lift the no contact with the defendant (sent to Br 2 JA on 05/27/22 sp)
Letter from P.C. dated 05/26/22 in re:  request to have the no contact terminated (sent to Br 2 JA on 05/27/22 sp)
Preliminary hearing on May 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

No contact with J.R.M. or P.F.C. unless consents in writing.
Allow contact with co-defendant, Paris Hammes, while he is in custody and they are to have no discussion about this case.
No contact with co-defendant, Dillon Worden.

2:48 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shannon F. Dio appeared by video.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Shannon F. Dio. 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond is set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Initial Appearance set for May 2, 2022 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 2
